remarks: If a linear operator (whose range is ` ~H ` ) is idempotent in the norm, the operator is unitary.  Similar to theorem in [AkhiezerGlazman] p. 73.  (Contributed by NM, 23-Jan-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
lnopuni.1 $e |- T e. LinOp $.
lnopuni.2 $e |- T : ~H -onto-> ~H $.
lnopuni.3 $e |- A. x e. ~H ( normh ` ( T ` x ) ) = ( normh ` x ) $.
lnopunii $p |- T e. UniOp $.
$d T x $.
